Keywords: 
aid grant higher 

Final sequence: 

Mr. Speaker, I rise today to pay tribute to the late Senator Robert C. Byrd as the sponsor of the Higher Education Assistance Program for Teachers and Staff Assistance Act of 2007. This legislation passed the Senate last month with no debate on the House floor or committee action for more than a year after it was introduced by Grant Obey and Representative Tom King in March of this year. Keywords: 
power drafted deliberately 

Final sequence: 

Mr. President, the ultimate power to enact legislation is not legislative appropriation or legislation drafted by the Congress. Rather, it is Congress itself that is the actual author or the ultimate agency in authorizing any legislation in the first place. Thus, when legislation is deliberately amended, or the wording of such legislation is changed or, perhaps most importantly, made by an executive, that agency is merely exercising its legislative authority. That is, the legislation passed by the Congress is, in effect, its own agency, and no other agency is vested with legislative responsibility.  The duty of legislative and executive agencies is thus to ensure that legislation

Mr. Chairman, I yield myself the balance of my time.  Mr. Chairman, Bill Colbeck would like you to believe that the crime bill that passed the House was not tough on law enforcement.
